title: Is it normal to dream every single night? - Quora

response.answer_text: 0:00-0:30 You are actually above normal, you lucky soul! Your subconscious mind is attempting to communicate with you through your dreams. Every human has three dreams per night —they simply don’t remember. Dreams occur during REM (Rapid Eye Movement) sleep. Our eyes move around even though our eye lids are closed. This cycle occurs around 90–120 minutes at least three times during the latter part of our sleep cycle. Humans have a “self-conscious mind” and a “subconscious mind” — but few people realize that their potential lies in the ability to develop a relationship between the two. Our self-conscious mind is what I call our “daylight mind” — it is our reasoning, logical mind that we use to make decisions in our everyday life. Our “midnight mind” is our subconscious mind that records every single sensation we experience during the day — what we see, hear, touch and smell.  Source: Francesca C. Simon Photography I mentioned this book by Carlos Castenada, regarding dreaming techniques. I wish to make clear that I have never, ever taken any kind of drugs to induce lucid dreaming. Castenada has written many books, and the first few are based on his experiences assisted by the use of hallucinogenic substances. I did not read any of those books because I wasn’t interested in drug-induced experiences. The first book I read was “Journey to Ixtlan” where he began to have experiences without drugs. One of the best exercises I learned from his books, was to look for my hands in my dream, when I realized I was dreaming. I will never forget dreaming that my mother, who was deceased, walked into a newsroom where I was working. I immediately began to look for my hands, but they felt weighed down by tons of water. But I finally succeeded— I raised my hands up to my face — it was exhilarating, despite the fact that my body was sleeping. I was consciously fully aware on that higher realm! You may find it hard to believe the experiences he writes about, but I found his books to be filled with techniques that can be helpful — but only if you are disciplined enough to do the work required!Always be a walking question mark. Yes, it is normal for a person to dream every night. Believe it or not, you actually dream everyday when you sleep. An average person dreams about 5 times per night. Even though you might not remember your dream or you did not feel like your dreamed at all, you did. Most of us forget 95 to 99 percent of our dreams. We don’t know why, but a theory suggests that it is because you’re not concentrating on them while you’re snoozing. Another theory states that the hormone associated with memory (norepinephrine) is turned off while we sleep. Everyone dreams at some point, so yes it is normal. It does not matter if you remember your dream or not. So is it normal that we dream every night? Yes. But the things we dream about? It depends.
